tier.item: (2) Possessor extension (German)
a. Die Brille zerbrach.
`The glasses broke'

a. Die Brille zerbrach.
`The glasses broke'

Die Brille zerbrach.
The glasses broke
b. Mir zerbrach die Brille.
me.DAT broke the glasses
`My glasses broke'

me.DAT broke the glasses
`My glasses broke'
Mir zerbrach die Brille.
me.DAT broke the glasses
My glasses broke
(3) Possessor extension combined with resultative (German)
a. Die Kinder liefen (*mir).
`The children ran (*me.DAT)'

a. Die Kinder liefen (*mir).
`The children ran (*me.DAT)'

Die Kinder liefen (*mir).

b. Die Kinder liefen mir den Rasen platt.
`The children ran my lawn flat'

`The children ran my lawn flat'

(4) Verb compound (Chinese)
a. Lisi zui-le.
Lisi inebriate-PERF
`Lisi became drunk'
(4) Verb compound (Chinese)
a. Lisi zui-le.
Lisi inebriate-PERF
`Lisi became drunk'
(4) Verb compound (Chinese)
Lisi zui-le.
Lisi inebriate-PERF
Lisi became drunk
b. *Nei-ping jiu zui-le Lisi.
that-CL wine inebriate-PERF Lisi
`That bottle of wine inebriated Lisi'
b. *Nei-ping jiu zui-le Lisi.
that-CL wine inebriate-PERF Lisi
`That bottle of wine inebriated Lisi'
Nei-ping jiu zui-le Lisi.
that-CL wine inebriate-PERF Lisi
That bottle of wine inebriated Lisi
c. Nei-ping jiu zui-dao-le Lisi.
that-CL wine inebriate-fall-PERF Lisi
`That bottle of wine inebriated Lisi so that he fell down'

(5) a. Er trank mir den Kühlschrank leer.
he drunk me.DAT the fridge empty
`He drunk (so much from my fridge) that as a result my fridge got empty
(of beverages)'

he drunk me.DAT the fridge empty
`He drunk (so much from my fridge) that as a result my fridge got empty
(of beverages)'

he drunk me.DAT the fridge empty

b. Sie fällten eine Schneise in the Wald.
they felled a lane into the woods
`They felled (so much trees) that as a result a lane came into existence in
the woods'

they felled a lane into the woods

the woods'

they felled a lane into the woods

c. Markus stellte den Keller voll.
Markus put the cellar full
`Markus put (so much things into the cellar) that as a result the cellar got
full'

full'

She er-wrote herself the Pulitzer prize.
`She won the Pulitzer prize by her writing'

c. xiao-hai ku-huang-le tamen de yeye-nainai.
small-child cry-get.confused-LE their grandpa-grandma
`The children cried so that their grand parents became confused'

24 An example is the following (Gamerschlag 1999):
(i) Rikisi ga aite o zimen ni osi-taosi-ta.
sumo.wrestler NOM opponent ACC ground to push-topple-PAST
`The sumo wrestler pushed his opponent to the ground.'
